newsitem.title: USA: Manufactured Home buys resort communities.
newsitem.headline: Manufactured Home buys resort communities.

text.p: Manufactured Home Communities Inc said Thursday it acquired two resort manufactured housing communities in Phoenix, Ariz., for a total price of $17 million in an all-cash transaction.

In addition to the Casa del Sol I, a 246-site community and and Casa del Sol II, a 239-site community, Manufactured Home said it obtained the right to acquire Case del Sol III, which is adjacent to Case del Sol II.
Manufactured Home now owns ten communities comprising 2,972 sites in Arizona.
The company, a real estate investment trust, is the largest owner and operator of manufactured housing communities in the United States.
Shares of Manufactured Home were trading unchanged at 19-7/8.
